metadata.title: CVE-2021-29462 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: The Portable SDK for UPnP Devices is an SDK for development of UPnP deviceand control point applications. The server part of pupnp (libupnp) appearsto be vulnerable to DNS rebinding attacks because it does not check thevalue of the `Host` header. This can be mitigated by using DNS revolverswhich block DNS-rebinding attacks. The vulnerability is fixed in version1.14.6 and later.

criterions.comment: libupnp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mediatomb: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
